title: Vintage Cameras
description: Classic cameras, film brands, and photography history

questions.question: Which company introduced the Brownie camera in 1900, making photography affordable for everyday people?
What type of instant camera did Edwin Land introduce in 1948, producing prints that developed before your eyes?
Which iconic 35mm film brand was known for its yellow boxes and the slogan 'Kodak moment'?
The Kodak Instamatic, introduced in 1963, used what easy-to-load film format?
Which German camera brand produced the legendary M-series rangefinder cameras favored by photojournalists?
What did photographers use in the early days of photography to produce a bright burst of light for indoor photos?
Which camera brand introduced the popular SX-70, a folding instant camera, in 1972?
What was the name of Kodak's disc-shaped film format introduced in 1982 that fit into ultra-thin cameras?
The twin-lens reflex (TLR) Rolleiflex camera was primarily designed to use what film size?
Which disposable camera brand became hugely popular at weddings and parties in the 1980s and 1990s?
What was the standard number of exposures on a typical roll of 35mm film?
Which type of camera used a bellows that folded out from the body and was common in the early 1900s?
The Argus C3, nicknamed 'The Brick' for its shape, was one of the best-selling cameras in which country?
What was the small, cube-shaped flash attachment that sat on top of cameras in the 1960s and 1970s called?
Which Swedish camera brand was used by NASA astronauts to photograph the Moon during the Apollo missions?
